biography.content: I am an experienced secondary school teacher and teacher educator who is currently a lecturer in Education Studies-  Global, Citizenship and Education at Manchester Metropolitan University. Formerly, I was a postdoctoral fellow at the University of Alberta's Department of Educational Policy Studies and Curriculum Coordinator at the Centre for Global Citizenship Education and Research there. I researched current trends in global citizenship education and support the work of the centre promoting initiatives for teachers and students in K-12 and higher education in promotion of critical approaches to global citizenship education. Previously I was a postdoctoral fellow at the University of Oulu in Finland. My main responsibility was to the large-scale comparative study Ethical Internationalism in Higher Education in Times of Global Crises (P. I. Vanessa Andreotti). It involved an extensive mixed-methods study of conceptualizations of internationalism in the view of policy texts, students, and faculty members in 28 universities in 10 countries in 5 continents. I also taught and supervised students in the Education and Globalisation graduate program. My PhD research at OISE/University of Toronto examined the overlooked tensions inherent to global citizenship education in multicultural contexts. I also worked in the initial teacher education program there, most recently as co-ordinator and instructor in the global citizenship and sustainable development cohort.

keyword.content: global citizenship education, ethical internationalism, critical multiculturalism, postcolonial theory
